intro: Evax lasiocarpa, commonly known as the roughleaf evax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Native to parts of Central and South America, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. The plant's unique foliage and floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
